title: What are appropriate and sustainable technologies? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is a great darkness surrounding this question. It seems sustainable technology is tied to inequality, group identity, economic stimulus, jobs, and just about everything else you can think of. No joke, it’s become almost impossible to have this conversation without conflating the issues. As a centrist Democrat who grew up in Minnesota, I find this all very disturbing. No doubt, we have serious equality issues to work out. We should continue to empower minorities and stop over criminalization. We should continue to improve the environment. To your question, we should think critically about our technology and how we improve the environment along with economics. Many folks act as if sustainable technology is synonymous with wind, solar, the battery, and the electric car. This is often accompanied by a belief in improving economics leading to universal adaptation of these technologies. Fair enough… The problem it that we can’t talk critically about the technology without drowning in that kitchen sink I mentioned earlier. Question anything about the technology and you will be labeled a lukewarm or more likely a climate denier. Yet, there are real problems that need to be addresses with regards to our energy systems. The quintessential things considered to be “sustainable technology” are not so perfect as many would have you believe. Here is a parable to illustrate the problem. What is considered sustainable technology today? May I suggest you take a look at Project Drawdown. You will find a list of 80 solutions for climate change. Some of these are clearly technological solutions. Some of the solutions are social changes which are just, if not more, effective. My hope is that we can engage in an honest discussion about which solutions are most appropriate. Regards, APDahlen
